entry.def: String is thin rope made of twisted threads, used for tying things together or tying up parcels.

example.ex: He held out a small bag tied with string.
example.tran: 他拿出一个系着细绳的小袋子。

example.ex: ...a shiny metallic coin on a string.
example.tran: 拴在绳子上的闪闪发亮的金属硬币

entry.def: A string of things is a number of them on a piece of string, thread, or wire.

example.ex: She wore a string of pearls around her neck.
example.tran: 她脖子上戴着一串珍珠。

entry.def: A string of places or objects is a number of them that form a line.

example.ex: The landscape is broken only by a string of villages...
example.tran: 这片风景中只有一排村庄。

example.ex: A string of five rowing boats set out from the opposite bank.
example.tran: 5 只划艇排成一行从对岸出发了。

entry.tran: 一系列，一连串(类似事件)
entry.def: A string of similar events is a series of them that happen one after the other.

example.ex: The incident was the latest in a string of attacks...
example.tran: 这是一连串袭击事件中最近的一起。

example.ex: Between 1940 and 1943 he had a string of 62 consecutive victories.
example.tran: 他在 1940 年至 1943 年间连续 62 次获胜。

entry.def: The strings on a musical instrument such as a violin or guitar are the thin pieces of wire or nylon stretched across it that make sounds when the instrument is played.

example.ex: He went off to change a guitar string.

entry.tran: (管弦乐团的)弦乐器，弦乐器组
entry.def: The strings are the section of an orchestra which consists of stringed instruments played with a bow.

example.ex: The strings provided a melodic background to the passages played by the soloist...
example.tran: 弦乐组为独奏乐章配上了动听的背景乐。
有一个 20 人组成的弦乐器组。

entry.tran: (计算机技术中的)字符串，信息串
entry.def: In computing, a string is a particular series of letters, numbers, symbols, or spaces, for example a word or phrase that you want to search for in a document.
If you string something somewhere, you hang it up between two or more objects.

example.ex: He had strung a banner across the wall.

entry.def: If someone has more than one string to their bow, they have more than one ability or thing they can use if the first one they try is not successful.

example.ex: I'm never out of work because I have so many strings to my bow.
example.tran: 我会很多手艺，永远都不会没饭吃。

entry.tran: 不带附加条件;无任何限制
entry.def: If something is offered to you with no strings attached or with no strings, it is offered without any special conditions.

example.ex: Aid should be given to developing countries with no strings attached.
example.tran: 应该不带任何附加条件地向发展中国家提供援助。

example.ex: ...no-strings grants that last for five years.
example.tran: 为期5 年的无附加条件的援助赠款

entry.def: If you pull strings, you use your influence with other people in order to get something done, often unfairly.

example.ex: Tony is sure he can pull a few strings and get you in.
example.tran: 托尼有把握可以托关系让你进去。

means.word_mean: 1. the section of an orchestra that plays stringed instruments
